channel.title: Comments on: Rethinking the IRC Experience

item.title: By: Flam
item.dc:creator: Flam
item.description:
I lol'd at the heavy breathing part.Â Well said man, you pretty much got IRC described perfectly.Â I didn't know those things about Linkinus, but I guess I'll take my friend's advice who has been trying to get me to buy it for months now. Your description of the two "issues" are dead on also.Â I quote issues because sometimes, at least personally, you can enjoy the quiet or the chaotic flow of conversations.Â For my channels I solve the quiet problem by having a bot post relevant news articles from feeds online at most once an hour just to spark up some discussions.
The noise problem is much more complicated.Â All I can think of from the top of my head is to disable join/part/quit notifications for that channel, highlight different users in different colors, or tell them to get a room :)
Perhaps you can do some clustering by figuring out who is talking to whom and color all their chat a certain color, rather than each person.Â Or go a step further and color based on current discussed subject.
I'd be interested to hear what you had in mind or if you've gotten any thing developed.
Cool blog btw, bookmarked.
